field.label: Manual config
field.help: Disable configuration file generation and manage the file (/usr/local/etc/kea/kea-dhcp4.conf) manually.

field.label: Valid lifetime
field.help: The valid life time of the leases given out by the server in seconds.

field.label: Firewall rules
field.help: Automatically add a basic set of firewall rules to allow dhcp traffic, more fine grained controls can be offered manually when disabling this option.

field.label: Socket Type
field.help: Socket type used for DHCP communication

field.label: Affinity lifetime
field.help: Defines in seconds for how long a returning client will be able to retrieve the same lease.

field.label: Reclamation delay
field.help: The interval in seconds between the completion of the previous reclamation cycle and the start of the next one.

field.label: Reclamation initiation
field.help: This parameter controls the server wait time in seconds between each lease reclamation procedure.

field.label: Maximum Reclamation time
field.help: Defines an upper limit in milliseconds to the length of time a lease reclamation procedure may take. Use "0" to disable the time limit.

field.label: Maximum reclamation leases
field.help: Defines the maximum number of reclaimed leases that can be processed at one time. Use "0" to set it to unlimited.

field.label: Cleanup circles
field.help: This parameter specifies how many consecutive clean-up cycles must end with remaining leases to be processed before a warning is printed.

field.label: Enabled
field.help: Enable High availability hook, requires the Control Agent to be enabled as well.

field.label: This server name
field.help: The name of this server, should match with one of the entries in the HA peers. Leave empty to use this machines hostname

field.label: Max Unacked clients
field.help: This specifies the number of clients which send messages to the partner but appear to not receive any response. A higher value needs a busier environment in order to consider a member down, when set to 0, any network disruption will cause a failover to happen.
